channel.title: Help help plz plz plz!
channel.description: Whenever i download a source or client for a 508 or 377 sometimes it has run but most of time it doesnt. If it has it doesnt work. Ive been told to copy a run from a diff server into one to give it a run... it then shows up for less than a second and disappears. Ive been told to get a better version of java also. I have jdk 6.12 so which of these ways works and what am i doing wrong? I dont use 508s much so plz help!

item.title: Help help plz plz plz!
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:8, topic:275965”]Just downloaded it to check it out. This compiler worked fine for me

[CODE]
@echo off
cls
cd …/build
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin\java.exe” net/com/espeon/Server 43594
goto main
pause

[CODE]

If that doesn’t work then I really don’t know what to tell you.[/code][/code][/quote]

nope didnt… well i normally do 317s and never have successfully done a 508 if that matters and i need to do something extra…

Read full topic

item.title: Help help plz plz plz!

item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Well the path to the Java directory is right. Try removing the 43594, I don’t think that should be in you Run file.

item.title: Help help plz plz plz!
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:2, topic:275965”][quote author=marcbob link=topic=364508.msg2766762#msg2766762 date=1240861845]
Whenever i download a source or client for a 508 or 377 sometimes it has run but most of time it doesnt. If it has it doesnt work. Ive been told to copy a run from a diff server into one to give it a run… it then shows up for less than a second and disappears. Ive been told to get a better version of java also. I have jdk 6.12 so which of these ways works and what am i doing wrong? I dont use 508s much so plz help!
[/quote]

If the screen quickly appears, then disappears, then it means that the system can’t find the proper location of your java. So either set your enviromental variables or edit the path to your Java bin within the Compiler. Yours could be “C:/Program Files/Java/jdk6_12/bin” Not certain, but fool around with it and you might get it.[/quote][quote=“Newty, post:2, topic:275965”][quote author=marcbob link=topic=364508.msg2766762#msg2766762 date=1240861845]
Whenever i download a source or client for a 508 or 377 sometimes it has run but most of time it doesnt. If it has it doesnt work. Ive been told to copy a run from a diff server into one to give it a run… it then shows up for less than a second and disappears. Ive been told to get a better version of java also. I have jdk 6.12 so which of these ways works and what am i doing wrong? I dont use 508s much so plz help!
[/quote]

If the screen quickly appears, then disappears, then it means that the system can’t find the proper location of your java. So either set your enviromental variables or edit the path to your Java bin within the Compiler. Yours could be “C:/Program Files/Java/jdk6_12/bin” Not certain, but fool around with it and you might get it.[/quote]

this is what is in my run…
@echo off
cls
cd …/build
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin\java.exe” net/com/espeon/Server 43594
goto main
pause

also this is a compiler on my 317 that WORKS…

@echo off
Title Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Help help plz plz plz!
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

marcbob:

Whenever i download a source or client for a 508 or 377 sometimes it has run but most of time it doesnt. If it has it doesnt work. Ive been told to copy a run from a diff server into one to give it a run… it then shows up for less than a second and disappears. Ive been told to get a better version of java also. I have jdk 6.12 so which of these ways works and what am i doing wrong? I dont use 508s much so plz help!

If the screen quickly appears, then disappears, then it means that the system can’t find the proper location of your java. So either set your enviromental variables or edit the path to your Java bin within the Compiler. Yours could be “C:/Program Files/Java/jdk6_12/bin” Not certain, but fool around with it and you might get it.

Read full topic
